required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Thorough QT/QTc Study of StaccatoÂ® Loxapine for Inhalation in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present Phase 1 study was to assess the cardiac safety of Staccato Loxapine administered to healthy volunteers in a 3 period crossover study.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Objective: To assess the maximum effect of Staccato Loxapine on cardiac repolarization (QTc interval duration) at the anticipated maximum clinical dose compared to placebo in healthy volunteers.
Secondary Objective: To assess the QTc versus loxapine concentration relationship following treatment with Staccato Loxapine in healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Effect of ADASUVE on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) at the Maximum Clinical Dose Compared to Placebo
primary_outcome.description: Largest of the upper CIs of the time matched differences in QTcI values between the maximum of the mean difference from baseline of the QTcI interval after time matched placebo subtraction for ADASUVE treatment at 12 prespecified post inhalation times

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Repolarization Change (QTcI) Versus Loxapine Concentration Relationship Following Treatment With Staccato Loxapine in Healthy Volunteers.
secondary_outcome.description: QTcI change at the median loxapine concentration (32.2 mcg/mL) based on nonlinear regression of QTcI versus log of time matched serum loxapine concentrations. This analysis looks for repolarization versus concentration relationship in a positive or negative thorough QT/QTc study result.

secondary_outcome.measure: Numbers and % of Subjects With QTcI > 450 ms
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers and Percents of Subjects with QTcI exceeding 450 ms

secondary_outcome.measure: Numbers and % of Subjects With QTcI > 480 ms
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers and Percents of Subjects with QTcI exceeding 480 ms

secondary_outcome.measure: Numbers and % of Subjects With QTcI Change > 30 ms
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers and Percents of Subjects with QTcI increase from baseline exceeding 30 ms

secondary_outcome.measure: Numbers and % of Subjects With QTcI Change > 60 ms
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers and Percents of Subjects with QTcI increase from baseline exceeding 60 ms

other_outcome.measure: Maximum Effect of Moxifloxacin on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) Compared to Placebo (Study Assay Sensitivity)
other_outcome.description: A thorough QT/QTc study may be considered to have demonstrated assay sensitivity if 1 or more of the lower 95% CI values exceeds 5 msec ant any of the 9 predetermined time points

arm_group.description: Treatment: A = Inhaled loxapine 10 mg, B = Placebo, C = Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg
Treatment: A = Inhaled loxapine 10 mg, B = Placebo, C = Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg
Treatment: A = Inhaled loxapine 10 mg, B = Placebo, C = Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg
Treatment: A = Inhaled loxapine 10 mg, B = Placebo, C = Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg

Treatment: A = Inhaled loxapine 10 mg, B = Placebo, C = Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg

intervention.description: Inhaled Staccato Loxapine 10 mg single dose
Oral placebo similar in appearance to moxifloxacin 400 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are in good general health and agree to use a medically acceptable and effective birth control method throughout the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have taken prescription or nonprescription medication within 5 days of treatment,
- Subjects who have had an acute illness within the last 5 days of treatment,
- Subjects who are smokers, OR
- Subjects who have an ECG abnormality at baseline.

results_reference.citation: Spyker DA, Voloshko P, Heyman ER, Cassella JV. Loxapine delivered as a thermally generated aerosol does not prolong QTc in a thorough QT/QTc study in healthy subjects. J Clin Pharmacol. 2014 Jun;54(6):665-74. doi: 10.1002/jcph.257. Epub 2014 Jan 22.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD submitted to regulatory authorities. Others may contact Alexza Pharmaceuticals, Inc. Please send your request to ClinicalTrialsDoc@alexza.com

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 132 subjects who were screened for the study, 69 did not meet criteria, 5 withdrew consent, 1 no show, 9 enrollment full. 48 (36.4%) were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study medication, and 46 completed the study

outcome.title: Maximum Effect of ADASUVE on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) at the Maximum Clinical Dose Compared to Placebo
outcome.description: Largest of the upper CIs of the time matched differences in QTcI values between the maximum of the mean difference from baseline of the QTcI interval after time matched placebo subtraction for ADASUVE treatment at 12 prespecified post inhalation times
outcome.population: QT population (all patients receiving both placebo and 10 mg inhaled loxapine. LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between Adasuve and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

group.title: Inhaled Loxapine 10 mg vs Placebo Crossover Subjects
group.description: Largest upper 95% Upper Confidence Bound (msec) for Inhaled loxapine QTcI Differences from Placebo in Change from Predose Baseline All upper CIs < 10 msec establishes this as a negative Thorough QT/QTc Study as defined in the ICH E14 guideline, 2005,

measure.title: Maximum Effect of ADASUVE on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) at the Maximum Clinical Dose Compared to Placebo
measure.description: Largest of the upper CIs of the time matched differences in QTcI values between the maximum of the mean difference from baseline of the QTcI interval after time matched placebo subtraction for ADASUVE treatment at 12 prespecified post inhalation times
measure.population: QT population (all patients receiving both placebo and 10 mg inhaled loxapine. LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between Adasuve and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

outcome.title: Cardiac Repolarization Change (QTcI) Versus Loxapine Concentration Relationship Following Treatment With Staccato Loxapine in Healthy Volunteers.
outcome.description: QTcI change at the median loxapine concentration (32.2 mcg/mL) based on nonlinear regression of QTcI versus log of time matched serum loxapine concentrations. This analysis looks for repolarization versus concentration relationship in a positive or negative thorough QT/QTc study result.
outcome.population: QT + PK Population (all subjects receiving placebo and loxapine who provided QTc and pharmacokinetic data). LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between loxapine and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

group.title: Inhaled Loxapine 10 mg
group.description: Largest upper 95% Upper Confidence Bound (msec) for Inhaled loxapine QTcI Differences from Placebo in Change from Predose Baseline

measure.title: Cardiac Repolarization Change (QTcI) Versus Loxapine Concentration Relationship Following Treatment With Staccato Loxapine in Healthy Volunteers.
measure.description: QTcI change at the median loxapine concentration (32.2 mcg/mL) based on nonlinear regression of QTcI versus log of time matched serum loxapine concentrations. This analysis looks for repolarization versus concentration relationship in a positive or negative thorough QT/QTc study result.
measure.population: QT + PK Population (all subjects receiving placebo and loxapine who provided QTc and pharmacokinetic data). LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between loxapine and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

outcome.title: Maximum Effect of Moxifloxacin on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) Compared to Placebo (Study Assay Sensitivity)
outcome.description: A thorough QT/QTc study may be considered to have demonstrated assay sensitivity if 1 or more of the lower 95% CI values exceeds 5 msec ant any of the 9 predetermined time points
outcome.population: All subjects who completed both Inhaled placebo + oral placebo and moxifloxacin 400 mg + Inhaled placebo. LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between moxifloxacin and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

group.title: Oral Moxifloxacin vs Placebo Crossover Subjects
group.description: Largest lower 95% Upper Confidence Bound (msec) for moxifloxacin QTcI Differences from Placebo in Change from Predose Baseline Lower CI > 5 msec at 1 or more time points establishes sensitivity of the QTc assay for the study

measure.title: Maximum Effect of Moxifloxacin on Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval Duration) Compared to Placebo (Study Assay Sensitivity)
measure.description: A thorough QT/QTc study may be considered to have demonstrated assay sensitivity if 1 or more of the lower 95% CI values exceeds 5 msec ant any of the 9 predetermined time points
measure.population: All subjects who completed both Inhaled placebo + oral placebo and moxifloxacin 400 mg + Inhaled placebo. LSM and CI statistics were based on the individual (within subject) corrected differences between moxifloxacin and placebo exposures per ICH Guideline E14 for a thorough QT study.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were considered treatment related from the first exposure to study treatment until 30 days after the last treatment
reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) were assessed predose and at 14 prespecified time points as well as whenever spontaneously reported by the subjects

group.description: Inhaled Staccato placebo single dose Oral moxifloxacin 400 mg Inhaled placebo: Inhaled Staccato placebo single dose Oral moxifloxacin: Oral Moxifloxacin 400 mg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The highest approved inhaled loxapine dose of 10 mg was studied. Supratherapeutic doses were not evaluated because of tolerability concerns in healthy subjects. The inclusion of only healthy subjects is likewise a limitation of this study.
